sdgs.relevance:
TOAEP has been built to indefinitely provide free and immediate access to quality publications on international law to anyone with access to the Internet, regardless of their geographical location. TOAEP will remain non-profit and open access. As such, TOAEP is aligned with Goal 4 of the Sustainable Development Goals (‘SDGs’) (that is, it will “ensure inclusive and equitable quality education and promote lifelong learning opportunities for all”)., 
TOAEP is directly aimed at Goal 16 of the SDGs (that is, to “promote peaceful and inclusive societies for sustainable development, provide access to justice for all and build effective, accountable and inclusive institutions at all levels”). By publishing open access international law information, including on international criminal law, TOAEP aims to equip individuals with the knowledge required to ensure that there is accountability for core international crimes in their societies, organisations and countries.

documentation: The complete library of TOAEP publications is freely and immediately available on the TOAEP web site (https://toaep.org/about/). The information required to access the publications is available on the web site. The electronic version of all publications is available as a PDF-file that can be freely accessed, printed or downloaded. No software is required beyond a web browser and PDF-reader. There is no need to register as a user. The TOAEP publications can be accessed by author name (https://toaep.org/authors/) or by five publication series into which they are organised:,1. The Publication Series (https://toaep.org/ps/), TOAEP's oldest series, which publishes books (monographs and anthologies);,2. The Policy Brief Series (https://toaep.org/pbs/) which publishes shorter texts of approximately 4,000 words in a fixed 4-page layout;,3. The Occasional Paper Series (https://toaep.org/ops/) which publishes longer texts of a scholarly nature that do not have the volume to be separate books;,4. The Nuremberg Academy Series (https://toaep.org/nas/) which publishes books linked to the activities of the International Nuremberg Principles Academy; and,5. The Law of the Future Series (https://toaep.org/lotfs/) which publishes books linked to the activities of The Hague Institute for Innovation of Law.

userContent.contentManagementPolicy: https://toaep.org/about/privacy/ No TOAEP content can be added unless explicitly approved by the TOAEP Editorial Team and its Editor-in-Chief (https://toaep.org/editors/). All manuscripts are subjected to review on multiple levels, involving a minimum of two editors. All members of the Editorial Team are lawyers. The TOAEP policy is zero tolerance of any illegal or inappropriate content as commonly understood, and to maintain TOAEP in such a way that it continues to be impossible for such content to be added to TOAEP. TOAEP is guided by applicable international human rights law standards.
